file_name: virtuososurgicalinc_20191227_1-a_ex1a-6 mat ctrct_11933379_ex1a-6 mat ctrct_license agreement.pdf

perturbation.original_text:
4.3
Running Royalties: Company shall pay to JHU, a running royalty as set forth in Exhibit A, for each LICENSED PRODUCT(S) sold
and each LICENSED SERVICE(S) provided, based upon NET SALES and NET SERVICE REVENUES respectively, for the term of
this Agreement. Such payments shall be made within thirty (30) days of the end of each calendar quarter following first
commercial sale of LICENSED PRODUCT or providing LICENSED SERVICES. All non-US taxes related to LICENSED
PRODUCT(S) and LICENSED SERVICE(S) sold under this Agreement shall be paid by Company and shall not be deducted from
royalty or other payments due to JHU.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.3
Running Royalties: Company shall pay to JHU, a running royalty as set forth in Exhibit A, for each LICENSED PRODUCT(S) sold
and each LICENSED SERVICE(S) provided, based upon NET SALES and NET SERVICE REVENUES respectively, for the term of
this Agreement. Such payments shall be made within sixty (60) days of the end of each calendar quarter following first
commercial sale of LICENSED PRODUCT or providing LICENSED SERVICES. All non-US taxes related to LICENSED
PRODUCT(S) and LICENSED SERVICE(S) sold under this Agreement shall be paid by Company and shall not be deducted from
royalty or other payments due to JHU.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction regarding the payment deadline for running royalties. Paragraph 4.3 initially states payments are due within thirty (30) days of the end of each calendar quarter. By modifying it to sixty (60) days, there is now internal inconsistency within the same paragraph, making it unclear which deadline should be enforced.

perturbation.original_text:
4.5
Late Payments: In the event that any payment due hereunder is not made when due, the payment shall accrue interest beginning
on the tenth day following the due date thereof, calculated at the annual rate of six percent (6%), the interest being compounded
on the last day of each calendar year. Each such royalty payment when made shall be accompanied by all interest so accrued.
Said interest and the payment and acceptance thereof shall not negate or waive the right of JHU to seek any other remedy, legal
or equitable, to which it may be entitled because of the delinquency of any payment.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.5
Late Payments: In the event that any payment due hereunder is not made when due, the payment shall accrue interest beginning
on the twentieth day following the due date thereof, calculated at the annual rate of six percent (6%), the interest being compounded
on the last day of each calendar year. Each such royalty payment when made shall be accompanied by all interest so accrued.
Said interest and the payment and acceptance thereof shall not negate or waive the right of JHU to seek any other remedy, legal
or equitable, to which it may be entitled because of the delinquency of any payment.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that interest accrues on late payments beginning on the tenth day following the due date. Changing this to the twentieth day creates a direct contradiction within the clause itself. This introduces ambiguity as to when exactly the late payment interest starts to accrue, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
6.2
Termination by Company: Company may terminate this Agreement and the license granted herein, for any reason, upon giving
JHU sixty (60) days written notice under Paragraph 8.1.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.2
Termination by Company: Company may terminate this Agreement and the license granted herein, for any reason, upon giving
JHU thirty (30) days written notice under Paragraph 8.1.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the notice period required for the Company to terminate the agreement from sixty (60) days to thirty (30) days, a clear contradiction is created. The ambiguity arises because it's unclear which notice period the Company must adhere to when deciding to terminate the agreement.
